title: Sampling Distribution of a Sample Mean: Honeytown
question_text: A survey conducted in Honeytown found that the average number of people per household was $4.3$ with a standard deviation of $1.2$ .  The true average size and standard deviation of a  household in Honeytown is $4.1$ and $0.98$ respectively. Using simple random samples of size $50$ ,  what are the mean and standard deviation for the sampling distribution of the sample means of  the number of people per household in Honeytown?
